[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between descriptive and anecdotal segments;
[CLARITY]: Assumes background knowledge of cultural references

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., multiple nested clauses in descriptions of headgear).
[LEXICON]: Occasional awkward phrasing (e.g., "for if a Yögur sells a piece of clothing, he has nothing with which to replace it").

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between topics (e.g., from clothing to household activities without connectors).
[STRUCTURE]: Lack of explicit thematic links between paragraphs (e.g., house interiors → clothing → labor division).
